Overwatch no longer needs heroes, as it has lived long enough to see itself become the villain.

Have you ever thought to yourself "Oh boy, I can't wait for a game sequel that strips away features, charges insane amounts of cash for skins I used to get for free, and is developed by a company with massive sexual harassment issues?" Well good news, because Blizzard is here with Overwatch 2 to defecate in your open mouth.
Been a huge fan of overwatch since 2017. Sad to see it go this way.

Other players will not like my review of overwatch 2 but I donâ€™t really care, I like overwatch 2 and with the gameplay mechanics and the fact that the first overwatch was updated to overwatch 2 and the fact that there are pve missions I like everything

In this complex world, there are a variety of ideas, cultures, religions, worldviews, and just as many misunderstandings, prejudices, and inequalities. Unfortunately, in the 21st century, in the year 2023, we can still see that the world has not yet eradicated war and famine, and there are still people who are displaced and suffering. Every time I think of this, it makes me feel incredibly sad and sorry. But today! It's comforting to know that here on Steam, no matter where you're from, what language you speak, or what ideology you support, we gamers from all over the world can come to a consensus on "Blizzard is a piece of shit" without any prior consultation, which is incredibly comforting and heartwarming, and it gives me hope for the world again. This is very gratifying and touching, and gives me hope for the world again.

Thank you Blizzard for giving the world a chance to come to a consensus, and thank you Blizzard for everything you've done.

Blizzard is shit!

In questo mondo complesso, con le sue diverse idee, culture, religioni e visioni del mondo, esistono altrettante incomprensioni, pregiudizi e disuguaglianze. Purtroppo, nel XXI secolo, nell'anno 2023, possiamo ancora vedere che il mondo non ha ancora sradicato la guerra e la carestia, e ci sono ancora persone sfollate e sofferenti. Ogni volta che penso a questo, mi sento incredibilmente triste e dispiaciuto. Ma oggi! Ãˆ confortante sapere che qui su Steam, indipendentemente dal luogo di provenienza, dalla lingua parlata o dall'ideologia sostenuta, noi giocatori di tutto il mondo possiamo trovare un accordo su "Blizzard Ã¨ un pezzo di merda" senza alcuna consultazione preliminare, il che Ã¨ incredibilmente confortante e scalda il cuore, e mi dÃ  di nuovo speranza per il mondo. Anche a me ha ridato speranza per il mondo.

Grazie Blizzard per aver dato al mondo la possibilitÃ  di raggiungere un consenso, e grazie Blizzard per tutto.

Blizzard Ã¨ una merda!

A worthy sequel to the classic team-based hero shooter. There is no time like the present, for both new players and long time veterans to jump in for some exciting matches, as the new update has brought a very welcome boost to this beloved game and its playerbase. Even now, in 2023, years after release, and in spite of many mishaps, poor decisions and at times near complete radio silence from the developers, the community of devout fans surrounding the game continues to thrive and breathe new life into this masterpiece, and will surely continue to do so for many years to come. At the time of its announcement, and later, release, many people questioned the need for full on sequel, but I think, that by now, the game has more than proved its merit as a truly unique, standalone experience. And with the game being free-to-play, there's no danger in at least giving the game a try. So download the game, play some matches, and I think you will quickly fall in love!

Anyway that's my review for TF2. 

I downloaded Overwatch 2 for the achievements, 10/10 experience, would recommend.

ÑÑƒĞºi Ğ´Ğµ ÑƒĞºÑ€Ğ°Ñ—Ğ½ÑÑŒĞºĞ° Ğ¼Ğ¾Ğ²Ğ°

Overwatch 2 is just really not that good. It feels like a sequel in name only, and a major change in monetization. I mean I guess its good that the loot boxes are gone? But the balance just feels very wrong now, and Blizzard doesn't listen to the playerbase. I remember the first major red flag in Overwatch's balancing issues, was when Jeff Kaplan was in charge of the direction of OW, and he routinely fought with players on the official Blizzard forums, and dismissed everyone's opinions. I get it, Blizzard's playerbase sucks and honestly shouldn't be listened to. This applies to most gamers, but in the case of Overwatch 2, history has proven players correct. 

To OW2's benefit and the maybe the one cool thing about the game that I like, is the characters. Their personality, presentation, and background lore/story. They are all really cool and fun. No other game has been able to capture this level of creativity in the class based competitive FPS sub-genre since. 

But there is also the problem that Overwatch 2 just doesn't feel like a sequel. Blizzard delayed the Story campaign, said nothing about it for a few years, and then canceled it outright. Now they are introducing it piece meal and charging $10 per PvE mission. Just completely absurd, and insulting to the playerbase because it's an unearned ask of us; OW2 is such a mediocre product as it stands, and is losing players left and right, that this is why the game has come to Steam at all, its a desperation attempt to save their biggest failure ever, but without doing any actual work. 

Blizzard as a company really sucks now. Hearthstone, Diablo IV, Overwatch 2, Heroes of the Storm, these are all really bad games that blow chunks. I have been playing Blizzards games since Warcraft II, and Diablo I, I miss when they made exciting games.
New platform, still the same old bad game.
There more unofficial NSFW for this game than there is actual official content

Launch your game on Wallpaper Engine instead of Steam

Overwatch 2 is a butchered version of the original game that has been converted to a cash grab. Most of the new content is overpriced, lazy and boring. The matchmaking and the balancing makes the game unplayable. Every match is "stomp or get stomped". There is also nothing to do in the game after unlocking the initial heroes. The only good thing about the game are the visual designs from the first game.
Thanks for ruining my favourite game blizzard.
imagine playing the actual game instead of watching widowmaker porn

incredibly trash game

Overwatch 2 - ÑÑ‚Ğ¾ Ğ½Ğµ Ğ¸Ğ³Ñ€Ğ°, Ğ° Ğ¿Ğ»Ğ¾Ñ‰Ğ°Ğ´ĞºĞ° Ğ´Ğ»Ñ Ğ¿Ğ¾ĞºÑƒĞ¿ĞºĞ¸ ÑĞºĞ¸Ğ½Ğ¾Ğ² Ğ¸ ĞºĞ¾ÑĞ¼ĞµÑ‚Ğ¸Ñ‡ĞµÑĞºĞ¾Ğ³Ğ¾ Ğ¼ÑƒÑĞ¾Ñ€Ğ° ÑÑ‚Ğ¾Ğ¸Ğ¼Ğ¾ÑÑ‚ÑŒÑ Ğ¾ĞºĞ¾Ğ»Ğ¾ 20 $

While I enjoyed the first game for what it was, gazing upon the shop made me fearful of what I was getting into.

Paid heroes, season passes, and PvE Invasion campaign which are all up for purchase; I think I could have stomached two of those at once. Not all three, under the guise of "F2P" sequel from a paid title.

Rest in peace, Overwatch 1.

May you suffer a quick death than a slow bleed out, Overwatch 2.

That said, I guess I ought to try out the 5 v 5... rather than criticize on its monetization and mourn for what-was, instead of embracing what-is. Let's see if it's worthy for me to edit this review more.
